[ Act No. 3912, November 20, 1931 ]
AN ACT MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR PUBLIC WORKS
Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the Philippines in Legislature assembled and by the authority of the same:
Section 1. The following sums, or so much thereof as may be necessary, are hereby appropriated out of any funds in the Insular Treasury not otherwise appropriated, to be at the disposal of the Director of Public Works, subject to the approval of the Secretary of Commerce and Communications and the provisions hereinafter set forth, for the purposes mentioned hereunder: 
See Printed Copy Volume 27 Page 373 to 404 
Section 2. Item 5, paragraph (e), subsection A, section 1 of Act Numbered Thirty-eight hundred and thirteen for the Province of Oriental Negros, Public Works Act for nineteen hundred thirty-one, is hereby repealed and transferred to item 4, paragraph (e), subsection A, section 1, to read as follows: For the Larena Elementary School, Oriental Negros, fourteen thousand pesos (P14,000). 
Items 3 and 4, paragraph (e), subsection A, section 1, for the Province of Occidental Misamis of Act Thirty-eight hundred and thirteen, known as the Public Works Act for nineteen hundred thirty-one, are hereby repealed and appropriated for the following school projects, to wit: For additional rooms to Oroquieta Elementary School, Occidental Misamis, three thousand pesos (P3,000); and for Oroquieta Home Economics Building, Occidental Misamis, four thousand pesos (P4,000). 
Section 3. All balances of the several appropriations made by this Act the destination of which has not been determined by proper authority on December thirty-first, nineteen hundred and thirty-two, and all balances of appropriations remaining free or unexpended on July thirty-first, nineteen hundred and thirty-three, shall revert to the unappropriated funds in the Insular Treasury, and thereafter shall not be available for expenditure except upon appropriation by the Legislature. 
Section 4. The sums appropriated in paragraphs (a), (i), (ll), (m), (n), (p), (q), (s), (u), (v), (w), and (x) shall be distributed in the discretion of the Secretary of Commerce and Communications, but those appropriated in the other paragraphs shall be available for immediate expenditure by the Director of Public Works: Provided, however, That in all construction works to be undertaken by the Government that require the use of cement, it shall be compulsory, the provisions of existing laws to the contrary notwithstanding, the use of cement manufactured by companies financed by the Government, except in those cases in which for reasons of cost, price and transportation, the use of other cement manufactured in the Philippines as verified by the Insular Auditor is more advantageous. 
Section 5. This Act shall take effect on January first, nineteen hundred and thirty-two.
